item.title: Normal Conjugacy
item.description: Problem Statement Let the random variables \(X_1, \dots X_n\) be normally distributed. \[ X_1,\dots, X_n \sim \mathcal{N}(\mu, \sigma^2)\\ \] With the sampling density function \[ p(X_i=x_i\mid \mu, \sigma^2) = (2\pi \sigma^2)^{-1/2} \, \exp \left\{ -\frac{(x_i-\mu)^2}{2\sigma^2}\right\} \] After the experiment, each realizations of the random variables has been found. The likelihood function is \[ \begin{align} p(X_1=x_1,\dots,X_n=x_n\mid\mu,\sigma^2) &= \prod_{i=1}^n (2\pi \sigma^2)^{-1/2} \, \exp \left\{ -\frac{(x_i-\mu)^2}{2\sigma^2}\right\} \\ &= (2\pi \sigma^2)^{-n/2} \, \exp \left\{ -\frac{1}{2\sigma^2}\sum_{i=1}^n(x_i-\mu)^2\right\} \end{align} \]
